Human rights must be the cornerstone of our foreign policy agenda. 10 years later and Sergei continues to help us uphold this standard. 

Today, we mourn him and we carry on his legacy by remembering: we are all capable of rising to the challenge and standing up for justice.

The Sergei Magnitsky & #GloMag Acts hold accountable perpetrators of violence & human rights abuses who may never face justice in their home countries - including those involved in Sergei's death. They make clear that the US stands w/ those whose rights & freedoms are repressed.
Inspired by his bravery and his story, I introduced The Sergei Magnitsky Rule of Law Accountability Act, and soon after, the Global #MagnitskyAct with my colleague, the late Senator John McCain.

Magnitsky was a tax lawyer who, in 2008, was jailed without trial and tortured after reporting his discovery of a tax scheme involving high-level Russian officials.
¬†
He spent nearly a year in jail and died 8 days before he was to be released.

Today is the 10th anniversary of the death of Sergei Magnitsky who, in his life and legacy, contributed to the fight against global corruption and inspired two of the most significant human rights accountability laws that exist today.

My time in El Salvador and my experience with the Jesuits has had a profound impact on my life and my work in Congress.

These priests were absolutely dedicated to justice and peace, and were totally and completely committed to the poor. https://www.americamagazine.org/faith/2019/11/06/martyred-jesuits-inspired-work-and-faith-massachusetts-congressman

What I discovered was deeply disturbing: not only did the high command of the Salvadoran military give the orders, but 19 of the 26 members of the unit that committed the murders had received U.S. taxpayer-funded training at the U.S. Army School of the Americas.

After public outrage, Congressman Joe Moakley, who I worked for at the time, asked me to help lead a commission to investigate what happened and make recommendations to Congress about U.S. policy toward El Salvador.

Fathers Ignacio Ellacur√≠a, ‚ÄúNacho‚Äù Martin-Bar√≥, and Segundo Montes ‚Äî who I had known and worked with ‚Äî along with Juan Ramon Moreno, Joaquin L√≥pez y L√≥pez, and Amando L√≥pez were killed for speaking out against a terrible war and for standing up for the poor and marginalized.

In the early morning hours of November 16, 1989, six Jesuit priests, their housekeeper Elba Ramos, and her daughter Celina ‚Äî both witnesses to what had happened ‚Äî were murdered by the Salvadoran military in a massacre that shocked the conscience of the world.

I thank @VetAffairsDems for passing this legislation out of committee recently and will continue to fight for it until it becomes law. 

Our veterans and Gold Star families have already sacrificed far too much. We have an obligation to provide them our support.

This additional bill would extend home & automobile leasing protections by allowing the spouses of catastrophically injured servicemembers to terminate property leases and automobile leases, and Gold Star spouses to terminate automobile leases.

It brings me great pride to say this bill was signed into law last year and I hope it will bring some relief to our Gold Star families among difficult times. But this Congress, I introduced a second piece of legislation to take it another step further.

No Gold Star family should experience that additional hardship while making the best decision for their family. So, thanks to Kylie's story, I introduced legislation that allows Gold Star spouses to terminate residential leases following a servicemember's death without penalty.

In particular, the story of the Riney Family from Farmington, IL has always stuck with me. Kylie Riney lost her husband Sgt. Douglas Riney and was confronted with costly lease cancellation fees when she moved her family back to IL from TX where her husband was stationed.

I was honored to have the opportunity to express my gratitude and participate in this ceremony of remembrance ‚Äì especially as we approach the holiday season and bring the week of Veterans Day to a close. Our Gold Star families have inspired me.

The Annual Fallen Heroes Tree of Honor Dedication in Peoria is such a moving tribute to our Gold Star families & their loved ones who paid the ultimate sacrifice in defense of the freedoms and values we all hold dear. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EJhnQusWkAEAmOm.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EJhnQuwXsAAlEHV.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EJhnQ6KWwAEMIBJ.jpg
